timeline.message: fixup! [BEAM-11338] Beam schema for thrift data
fixup! [BEAM-11338] Beam schema for thrift data

timeline.bodyText: This won't be in 2.26.0 as that release branch has already been cut, it will likely be in 2.27.0
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -96,6 +96,7 @@
 * Added support for avro payload format in Beam SQL Pubsub Table ([BEAM-5504](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5504))
 * Added option to disable unnecessary copying between operators in Flink Runner (Java) ([BEAM-11146](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11146))
 * Added CombineFn.setup and CombineFn.teardown to Python SDK. These methods let you initialize the CombineFn's state before any of the other methods of the CombineFn is executed and clean that state up later on. If you are using Dataflow, you need to enable Dataflow Runner V2 by passing `--experiments=use_runner_v2` before using this feature. ([BEAM-3736](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3736))
+* Added a schema provider for thrift data ([BEAM-11338](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11338))

timeline.message: fixup! [BEAM-11338] Beam schema for thrift data

timeline.bodyText:
It irks me a little bit that this is in an io/thrift module, while the protobuf SchemaProvider is in an extensions/protobuf. With your ThriftCoder change this module is looking a lot like the protobuf one.
But whether we call it an IO module or an extension makes little practical difference... I think you're doing the right thing by just expanding the existing io/thrift module.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: I agree, I noticed this but thought my patch does not deserve a structural change or a dedicated module.
replies.author: ccciudatu

timeline.bodyText:
You can exclude this class by adding it to the generatedClassPatterns in build.gradle, like how its done in for protobuf: 
  
    
      beam/sdks/java/extensions/protobuf/build.gradle
    
    
        Lines 20 to 26
      in
      c5d5b9a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           applyJavaNature( 
        

        
          
             generatedClassPatterns: [ 
        

        
          
               /^org\.apache\.beam\.sdk\.extensions\.protobuf\.Proto2CoderTestMessages/, 
        

        
          
               /^org\.apache\.beam\.sdk\.extensions\.protobuf\.Proto2SchemaMessages/, 
        

        
          
               /^org\.apache\.beam\.sdk\.extensions\.protobuf\.Proto3SchemaMessages/, 
        

        
          
               /^org\.apache\.beam\.sdk\.extensions\.protobuf\.Proto3SchemaOptions/, 
        

        
          
             ], 
        
    
  


(Same for the other generated classes)
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@

+package org.apache.beam.sdk.io.thrift;
+
+@SuppressWarnings({
+  "nullness" // TODO(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10402)
+})

timeline.bodyText: It could be nice if this linked to the (future) javadoc for ThriftSchema. The javadoc doesn't exist now, but it will once this file is turned into release notes and a blog post.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -63,6 +63,7 @@
 * Beam modules that depend on Hadoop are now tested for compatibility with Hadoop 3 ([BEAM-8569](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8569)). (Hive/HCatalog pending)
 * Publishing Java 11 SDK container images now supported as part of Apache Beam release process. ([BEAM-8106](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-8106))
 * Added Cloud Bigtable Provider extension to Beam SQL ([BEAM-11173](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11173), [BEAM-11373](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11373))
+* Added a schema provider for thrift data ([BEAM-11338](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-11338))

replies.bodyText:
I added comprehensive javadoc for ThriftSchema, so the future is almost here :). Please have a look and let me know if I covered everything.
By linking to the future javadoc, you mean pointing to this URL: https://beam.apache.org/releases/javadoc/2.27.0/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/thrift/ThriftSchema.html ?
Everything else in the CHANGES.md file seems to point to Jira, but I'm fine either way.
replies.author: ccciudatu

replies.bodyText:
Yeah you're right we don't do that for anything else, this is fine.
The javadoc looks great! My only nit: All the bullet points should be capitalized and have periods
replies.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText:
Could you try to address the nullness errors? We're working on removing all these class-level suppressions.
If it's too much trouble this is fine for now, at least the implementation is not suppressed.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText:
I removed the class-level suppression, but had to keep this at the method level for half of of the tests. Is this acceptable?
One funny thing is that assertNotNull() expects the argument to be @NonNull already.
replies.author: ccciudatu

replies.bodyText: Oh yes I ran into this as well but forgot about it. I just filed BEAM-11436 to track this problem, could you please link that in the TODO? It's fine if you just do it at the class level, sorry for the churn.
replies.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText:
Sure, I'll revert and point to the new Jira.
Meanwhile, I found another annoying restriction of the checker:
if (value == null) {
    setSomething(null); // not allowed
    setSomething(value); // allowed
}

And the compiler warns about value being always null here.
replies.author: ccciudatu

timeline.bodyText: This should never happen with generated code, so we don't need to bother keeping track /inferring of the actual parameter type in order to choose the proper factory method here.
